intro: Parablechnum camfieldii, commonly known as the Camfield's burrhead, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
